elements.name: Survey21 Introduction
elements.html:
Welcome to the Military Triage Delegation Experiment. Here you will have the chance to review the decisions of other medical professionals in difficult triage scenarios to assess whether you would delegate a triage situation in the future to those decision makers.

Each scenario is presented followed by how two different medics carried out their assessment and treatment separately for that situation. Their actions are listed in the order they performed them.

Each medic vignette is then followed by a few questions to assess how you perceived the medic’s decision-making style.

While you work your way through each vignette imagine you have seen a lot of other observations of this medic, and the behavior you see here is typical for how they behave.

Some of the scenarios will seem familiar to you. Please note that there may be differences in the details of the situation you saw and the one you will be evaluating. Specifically, please pay careful attention to what information is revealed to the decision maker, and consider their actions only with respect to the information they were given. Do not consider any information from your experience that might be different or contradictory.

The survey should take about 30 minutes to complete. Thank you for your participation.

elements.name: Note
elements.html:
Note that in some scenarios, there are buttons that expand/select the information for the medic and the patients.

Note that you can hit the "previous" button if you want to go back to any part of the survey.

elements.title: ST QOL 1 Scenario: Medic-A0
elements.name: ST QOL 1 Scenario: Medic-A0
actions: Update: New patients discovered: ['Casualty N', 'Casualty O']
Treat Casualty N with tourniquet on left face
Update: New patients discovered: ['Casualty U', 'Casualty W']
Treat Casualty W with tourniquet on right bicep
Update: Casualty W loses consciousness
Update: New patients discovered: ['Casualty G', 'Casualty Y']
Update: New patients discovered: ['Casualty X', 'Casualty Y']
Treat Casualty X with hemostatic gauze on head
Update: New patients discovered: ['Casualty G', 'Casualty H']
Treat Casualty H with pressure bandage on left bicep
Update: New patients discovered: ['Casualty L', 'Casualty Z']
Update: New patients discovered: ['Casualty A', 'Casualty Z']
Treat Casualty Z with tourniquet on right hand
Update: New patients discovered: ['Casualty L', 'Casualty M']
Treat Casualty M with tourniquet on right forearm
elements.explanation: The medic explains that they acted immediately and focused on one patient to do the most good.
elements.situation: You are part of a special operations tactical team tasked for extraction of hostages in enemy territory. Local support is unlikely, and the plan is for immediate extraction via Blackhawk. The hostages are being kept in a building guarded by 25 hostile narco-terrorists. Intel suggests the building may be wired with explosives, hostiles are threatening to kill the hostages in the next hour Upon entering the building you are immediately notified of two casualties in different locations. Casualty O has a penetrating wound to the abdomen and Casualty U is unresponsive. Who do you treat first?

patients.name: Casualty A
patients.description: Has a 40% body surface area burn

patients.name: Casualty G
patients.description: Has penetrating trauma to the abdomen and is bleeding

patients.name: Casualty H
patients.description: Has a puncture to the leg and is bleeding

patients.name: Casualty L
patients.description: Has a 50% body surface area burn

patients.name: Casualty M
patients.description: Has bilateral amputation of both legs

patients.name: Casualty N
patients.description: Has an amputation of the leg

patients.name: Casualty U
patients.description: Has a head injury with periorbital ecchymosis

patients.name: Casualty W
patients.description: Has a gunshot wound to the leg with severe bleeding

patients.name: Casualty X
patients.description: Has a puncture wound to the leg and is bleeding

patients.name: Casualty Y
patients.description: Has a puncture to the leg and is bleeding

patients.name: Casualty Z
patients.description: Has lacerations to both arms and legs

actions: Treat Casualty N with tourniquet on left face
Treat Casualty W with tourniquet on right bicep
Treat Casualty X with hemostatic gauze on head
Treat Casualty H with pressure bandage on left bicep
Treat Casualty Z with tourniquet on right hand
Treat Casualty M with tourniquet on right forearm
